text: Gilmer is an extinct town in Klickitat County, in the U.S. state of Washington. The GNIS classifies it as a populated place. A post office called Gilmer was established in 1883, and remained in operation until 1919. George W. Gilmer, an early postmaster, gave the community his name. ==References== Category:Ghost towns in Washington (state) Category:Geography of Klickitat County, Washington
title: Gilmer, Washington
